Agreed, this isn't even like the random packs in ME3's MP, this is PVP so if other people spend more they can get stronger characters way more often then you and the strongest ones can't be crafted, Joe Spent 56$ on the elite packs containing a total of 15 cards selected only from the 3 best tiers of cards and only got 1 Gold and 14 silvers, buying a single card with in game currency takes up to 10 rounds of gameplay if you score allot,
topics.author: 509f70a87f123b77eb0004fd

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5575563d63687267af0051ef#post_5575563d63687267af0051ef
Oi; Thanotos you might find this interesting but I was looking at changes in video gaming currently going on, but short version is:
Generic fps games that are for college frat boys/prepubescent kids are dying hard.

Obviously fps games aren't going anywhere any time soon, rather CoD and that sort of game is crashing.

You know how for years people have been saying that the video game industry was going to crash again?  Turns out they were partially right; the video game industry is doing fine, but as Yahtzee calls it "spunkgargleweewee" games are dying.  The theory is that now that games can't improve their graphics anymore they don't have anything to fall back on and therefore they can't compete.


The "*GRAPHICS!*" movement is dead; say hello to the beginning stages of another golden age of gaming.

CoD will likely stay a viable series, but the droves of FOOLS! who don't understand that there is no perfect pasta sauce will die off, unable to keep throwing more money at the issue, the simple fact is CoD perfected the formula for it's Sub Genre, and used the least valuable part the single player as a glorified tutorial for the main event, to put it bluntly they are as close to perfect at what they do as they can be, that's why they dominated so hard when other games aimed at the same targets didn't, CoD was just better at it then them,

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55755dcd6368726d8f00065c#post_55755dcd6368726d8f00065c
Here's some good news for both democrats and republicans:
She will win enough votes to win in 2016, but democrats won't win enough seats for a super majority.  Presidents are most active during their first two years.  Essentially by the time democrats get enough seats in congress she'll be too long on in her presidency to try to backstab the people.

The reason why I think that is going to be good is that when you look at it tea partiers politically are dying; all we have to do now is wait long enough for authoritarian democrat niche to die.  If Hillary becomes a dead on arrival president then she can't try to backstab the people and thus can't claim she did all the good she'll take credit for.

The way I'm viewing it:
Tea party is dying
If Hillary is a dead on arrival president then she won't be able to pass authoritarian legislation.

topics.body:
So, I'm playing Hitman Sniper.
It's pretty awesome, except for a couple flaws.
1: It's always the same map. I would at least like it if I wasn't put in the same spot every time.
2: Every targets and guards always does the same thing each missions. They should do different things for different opportunities.
Overall, it's amazing.
topics.author: 5446fcfc6368723ec21a0000

topics.body:
In the manga Seven Deadly Sins, four out of seven sins have been revealed. The newest being the sin of Envy.

Wrath: Destruction of a powerful kingdom of knights.
Sloth: Irresponsibility of a king that left his fairie kingdom to die.
Greed: Destruction of said fairie kingdom to achieve immortality.
Envy: Murder of stronger partner and 330 soldiers.

Don't know the crimes of the sins of Lust and Gluttony yet. The sin of Pride has yet to be seen.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976
